title.rendered: Secret Benefits of Collagen To Unlock The Body’s Potential

content.rendered:
ThriveRock Medicine 3.0

In a world obsessed with the latest health trends and superfoods, there’s one powerful nutrient sweeping the nation: collagen.

Collagen serves as structural support, orchestrating essential functions within the body. Their unparalleled specificity and potency make them ideal candidates for addressing various health conditions”

— Dr. Nizar Salem

LAS VEGAS, NEVADA, UNITED STATES, March 30, 2024 /EINPresswire.com/ — In a world obsessed with the latest health trends and superfoods, there’s one powerful nutrient sweeping the nation: collagen.

While most may associate collagen with skincare products or anti-aging treatments, its benefits extend far beyond improving the appearance of the skin.

Collagen plays a crucial role in unlocking the body’s true potential, offering myriad secret benefits that may transform one’s overall health and well-being.

What Is Collagen? How Does It Work?

Collagen is the most abundant protein in the human body. It is responsible for maintaining the structure, strength, and elasticity of skin, bones, muscles, tendons, and ligaments. This essential protein works like a scaffold that holds everything together.

As the body naturally ages, the body’s collagen production decreases, which can lead to visible signs of aging, such as wrinkles and sagging skin.

By incorporating collagen-boosting foods or supplements into a diet, the body can potentially help replenish collagen levels and promote healthier skin and joints.

Dr. Lonnie Empey, a specialist in longevity health medicine and a Medicine 3.0 Doctor, recommends proper hydration, exercise, and a balanced diet rich in collagen and vitamins C & E.

“Collagen is absolutely essential for the body and longevity, plus it’s easily found in everyday foods,” said Dr. Lonnie Empey. Collagen can be found in certain foods such as bone broth, chicken skin, fish, and animal connective tissues like tendons and ligaments.

Collagen supplements are also growing in popularity due to their easy digestive properties.

How Collagen Assists With Chronic & Acute Conditions

Collagen, often recognized for its role in skin health and anti-aging benefits, also significantly assists with managing chronic and acute conditions.

Specifically, research suggests that collagen supplements may help alleviate joint pain by promoting the strength and integrity of cartilage tissues.

https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC10058045/

This can lead to reduced inflammation and improved mobility for individuals suffering from conditions such as osteoarthritis or rheumatoid arthritis.

Studies indicate that collagen supplements may reduce joint pain by enhancing the resilience of cartilage tissues. This strengthened cartilage may decrease inflammation and enhance mobility, which is particularly beneficial for individuals with osteoarthritis or rheumatoid arthritis.

Collagen Supplements To Assist Heart Health

Studies have suggested collagen supplements may help support cardiovascular health by promoting blood vessel elasticity and reducing arterial stiffness.

Collagen is a key component of the connective tissues in the arteries, and maintaining healthy collagen levels may contribute to overall heart health.

Additionally, collagen supplementation has been linked to potential reductions in blood pressure, inflammation, and oxidative stress, all of which are important factors in maintaining a healthy heart.

Dr. Nizar Salem, a board-certified internal medicine specialist, has noted collagen’s vital roles within the body.

“Collagen serves as structural support, orchestrating essential functions within the body. Their unparalleled specificity and potency make them ideal candidates for addressing a wide range of health conditions.”

Dr. Salem recommends incorporating collagen supplements into a daily routine to support heart health alongside other lifestyle changes, such as regular exercise and a balanced diet.

Potential Benefits of Collagen For Gut Health

Collagen may also play a crucial role in improving gut health. Research suggests that collagen may help strengthen the intestinal lining, which may reduce inflammation and improve overall digestion.

By supporting the gut barrier function, collagen may potentially promote better absorption of nutrients and prevent harmful substances from leaking into the bloodstream.

Moreover, collagen contains essential amino acids like glycine and proline, which are beneficial for maintaining a healthy digestive system. In fact, many doctors recommend collagen in a gut health optimization program to potentially address a patient’s gut issues.

The information provided in this article is for general knowledge only and should not replace personalized medical advice.

Do not ignore professional medical advice or delay seeking it based on the information in this article. Always consult with a healthcare provider for personalized advice on exercise and health.

ThriveRocK Medicine 3.0
